intro: Leontodon cichoriaceus, commonly known as the common dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and a long, hollow stem that supports a single, prominent flower head. The flower head consists of both ray and disk florets, which are typically yellow in color. The plant produces a distinctive seed head composed of tiny, parachute-like seeds that are easily dispersed by the wind. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as lawns and roadsides.
